etymologies: late Middle English: from French, or from Latin zona ‘girdle’, from Greek zōnē

definitions: an area or stretch of land having a particular characteristic, purpose, or use, or subject to particular restrictions

examples.text: the government has declared the city a disaster zone

shortDefinitions: area or stretch of land having particular characteristic

crossReferenceMarkers: See also frigid zone, temperate zone, torrid zone
definitions: a well-defined region extending around the earth between definite limits, especially between two parallels of latitude
a range of longitudes where a common standard time is used.
shortDefinitions: range of longitudes where common standard time is used

definitions: (especially in sport) a state of such concentration that one is able to perform at the peak of one's physical or mental capabilities

examples.text: I was in the zone, completing the first nine holes in one under par

definitions: (in basketball, football, and hockey) a specific area of the court, field, or rink, especially one to be defended by a particular player.
shortDefinitions: football, and hockey, specific area of court

definitions: an encircling band or stripe of distinctive color, texture, or character.
shortDefinitions: encircling band or stripe of distinctive colour or character

definitions: a belt or girdle worn around a person's body.
shortDefinitions: belt or girdle worn round person's body

definitions: divide into or assign to zones

examples.text: the park has been zoned into four distinct bioregions, each with its own ecological identity

shortDefinitions: divide into or assign to zones

definitions: divide (a town or piece of land) into areas subject to particular restrictions on development and use

examples.text: towns and cities must have the latitude to zone real property in the best interest of all

shortDefinitions: divide town or piece of land into areas subject to particular planning restrictions

definitions: designate (a specific area) for use or development as a particular zone in planning

examples.text: the land is zoned for housing

shortDefinitions: designate specific area for use or development as particular zone in planning

definitions: encircle as or with a band or stripe.
shortDefinitions: encircle as or with band or stripe
